text: Isaiah
Superscription
The vision of Isaiah son of Amoz, which he saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem in the days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, \add and\add* Hezekiah, kings of Judah.
Rebellious Judah
Hear, heavens,
and listen, earth,
for Yahweh has spoken:
“I reared children
and I brought \add them\add* up,
but they rebelled against me.
An ox knows its owner
and a donkey the manger of its master.
Israel does not know;
my people do not understand.
Ah, sinful nation,
a people heavy \add with\add* iniquity,
offspring of evildoers,
children who deal corruptly.
They have forsaken Yahweh;
they have despised the holy one of Israel.
They are estranged \add and gone\add* backward.
Why do you want to be beaten again?
You continue \add in\add* rebellion.
\add The\add* whole of \add the\add* head \add is\add* sick,
and \add the\add* whole of \add the\add* heart \add is\add* faint.
From the sole of the foot and up to \add the\add* head
there is no health in it;
bruise and sore and bleeding wound have not been cleansed,
and they have not been bound up
and not softened with the oil.
Your country \add is\add* desolate,
your cities \add are\add* burned \add with\add* fire;
\add As for\add* your land, aliens are devouring it in your presence,
and \add it is\add* desolate, like devastation \add by\add* foreigners.
And the daughter of Zion is left like a booth in a vineyard,
like a shelter in a cucumber field,
like a city that is besieged.\f + \fr 1:8 \ft Or “preserved” \f*
If Yahweh of hosts had not left us survivors,\f + \fr 1:9 \ft Hebrew “survivor” \f*
we would have been as few as Sodom,
we would have become like Gomorrah.
Hear the word of Yahweh, rulers of Sodom!
Listen \add to\add* the teaching of our God, people of Gomorrah!
What \add is the\add* abundance of your sacrifices to me? says Yahweh.
I have had enough \add of\add* burnt offerings of rams
and \add the\add* fat \add of\add* fattened animals
and I do not delight in \add the\add* blood of bulls
and ram-lambs and goats.
When you come to appear before me,
who asked for this from your hand:
you trampling my courts?
You must not ⸤continue⸥\f + \fr 1:13 \ft Literally “increase” or “add to” \f* to bring offerings\f + \fr 1:13 \ft Hebrew “offering” \f* of futility,
incense—it \add is\add* an abomination to me;
new moon and Sabbath, \add the\add* calling of a convocation—
I cannot endure iniquity with \add solemn\add* assembly.
Your new moons and your appointed festivals my soul hates;
they have become to me like \add a\add* burden,
I am not able to bear \add them\add*.
And when you stretch out your hands,
I will hide my eyes from you;
even though you make many prayers,\f + \fr 1:15 \ft Hebrew “prayer” \f*
I \add will\add* not be listening.
Your hands are full of blood.
Wash! Make yourselves clean!
Remove the evil of your doings from before my eyes!
Cease to do evil!
Learn to do good!
Seek justice! Rescue \add the\add* oppressed!
Defend \add the\add* orphan! Plead for \add the\add* widow!
“Come now, and let us argue,” says Yahweh.
“Even though your sins are like scarlet, they will be white like snow;
even though they are red like crimson, they shall become like wool.
If you are willing and you are obedient,
you shall eat the good of the land.
But if you refuse and you rebel, you shall be devoured \add by the\add* sword.
For the mouth of Yahweh has spoken.”
Purifying Jerusalem
How has a faithful city become like a whore?
Full of justice, righteousness lodged in her, but now murderers.
Your silver has become \add as\add* dross;
Your wine \add is\add* diluted with waters.
Your princes \add are\add* rebels
and companions of thieves.
Every one loves a bribe
and runs after gifts.
They do not defend \add the\add* orphan
and \add the\add* legal dispute of \add the\add* widow does not come before them.
Therefore, the declaration of the Lord Yahweh of hosts, the Mighty One of Israel:
“Ah, I will be relieved of my enemies,
and I will avenge myself on my foes.
And I will turn my hand against you;
I will purify your dross like lye,
and I will remove all \add of\add* your tin.
And I will restore your judges, as at the first,
and your counselors, as at the beginning.
After this ⸤you will be called⸥\f + \fr 1:26 \ft Literally “it will be called for you” \f* the city of righteousness,
faithful city.
Zion will be redeemed by justice,
and those of her who repent, by righteousness.
But \add the\add* destruction \add of\add* rebels and sinners \add shall be\add* together,
and those who forsake Yahweh will perish.
For you\f + \fr 1:29 \ft Literally “they,” but a few manuscripts read “you,” which fits the context better \f* will be ashamed of \add the\add* oaks \add in\add* which you delighted,
and you will be disgraced because of the gardens that you have chosen.
For you shall be like an oak withering its leaves,
and like a garden where there is no water for her.
And the strong \add man\add* shall become like tinder,
and his work like a spark.
And both of them shall burn together,
and there is not one to quench \add them\add*.”
